concept.title: What's new
concept.shortdesc: Learn what's new and different in this DITA release.

ul.li:
The IBM version of DITA 1.3.2 was merged with the OASIS version of DITA.
On the Table element, the Expanse attribute has changed to PGWide.
The SpanSpec and TFoot elements are not part of the OASIS specification.
For additional information, see the OASIS DITA specification: OASIS Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA) TC (http://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=dita).

IBM additions for this release are:
In DITA topics: calloutlabel represents a graphic or program listing callout. It is usually a reverse-image letter or number.
In DITA maps:
metacategory groups a category of metadata, such as SDF metadata, package metadata, or translation metadata.
metaproperty defines the properties of a set of metadata.
metatext contains a text description of a metadata property.
metatextval defines a text description of a metadata property.
overrideShortdesc allows you to force a short description into a topic, regardless of the locktitle and lockmeta attribute values.
overrideTitle allows you to force a title or heading into a topic, regardless of the locktitle and lockmeta attribute values.
You can use the topicref element to support merging multiple maps into a single unit. This differs from maplist, which keeps each map separate. See .
All the Contains and Contained by information in the reference topics is updated.

conbody.p: For release 3.8.3: No changes to DITA itself. There are change to this guide in terms of examples and descriptions.

For release 3.8.2:
Alt: New to the Image element; the alt attribute is deprecated but still supported. The alt element is the preferred way of indicating alternative text for an image. See
ImageMap: Supports the creation of client-side image maps. See
PropHead: Property tables now have default headings. This allows you to specify your own headings.
The element can be used in more places in your document. This allowing it to be more easily used as a content reference source and target; for symbol-like instances. For examples, see: .

Elements with attribute changes:
These elements have an added outputclass attribute, to allow CSS settings for their XHTML output: b, i, u, tt, sub, and sup.
These map relationship table elements have the following added attributes:
Conref and ID attributes added to reltable, relrow, and relcell.
Platform, product, audience, rev, and otherprops added to relrow.
The metadata element has an optional, additional mapkeyref attribute.

Elements with processing updates:
Codeblock: The scale attribute and the expanse attribute cause the content to be scaled proportionately in the PDF output.
Phrases and keywords can have styles applied during PDF or other non-HTML output; see .
DITA maplists can now have relative directories; see .
